title: Plant Structures and Functions

vocab.definition: The parts of something and how they are arranged
The job or purpose that something does
The parts of a plant that grow underground and take in water and minerals
The part that holds the plant up and carries water and food
Flat green parts where photosynthesis happens
The part of the plant that makes seeds

teachingNotes: Examine real plants or detailed pictures. Connect structure to function. Use hands-on activities to show how different parts help plants survive.

sample.question: What is the main function of a plant's roots?
Which plant part carries water to the leaves?
What is a function of leaves besides photosynthesis?
How do roots help keep a plant in place?

truefalse.question: Each part of a plant has a specific job that helps the plant survive.
Leaves only help plants by making flowers.
Roots absorb water and minerals from the soil.
The stem helps move water and food around the plant.
All plants have the exact same structures.
Leaves are usually green because of chlorophyll.

multiplechoice.question: Which plant part is responsible for making food?

Which part mostly takes in water?
